intro: Ruschia fugitans, commonly known as the escaping Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, and yellow, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its rapid growth and spread, it is sometimes considered invasive in certain regions.
